books.author: by John Bolton
books.description: The former national security advisor gives his account of the 17 months he spent working for President Trump.
books.name: THE ROOM WHERE IT HAPPENED

books.author: by Robin DiAngelo
books.description: Historical and cultural analyses on what causes defensive moves by white people and how this inhibits cross-racial dialogue.
books.name: WHITE FRAGILITY

books.author: by Ibram X. Kendi
books.description: A primer for creating a more just and equitable society through identifying and opposing racism.
books.name: HOW TO BE AN ANTIRACIST

books.author: by Ibram X. Kendi
books.description: Winner of the 2016 National Book Award for nonfiction. A look at anti-Black racist ideas and their effect on the course of American history.
books.name: STAMPED FROM THE BEGINNING

books.author: by Ijeoma Oluo
books.description: A look at the contemporary racial landscape of the United States.
books.name: SO YOU WANT TO TALK ABOUT RACE

books.author: by Glennon Doyle
books.description: The activist and public speaker describes her journey of listening to her inner voice.
books.name: UNTAMED

books.author: by Ta-Nehisi Coates
books.description: Winner of the 2015 National Book Award for nonfiction. A meditation on race in America as well as a personal story, framed as a letter to the author's teenage son.
books.name: BETWEEN THE WORLD AND ME

books.author: by Richard Rothstein
books.description: An examination of the ways in which the government caused residential segregation through racial zoning and other systemic practices.
books.name: THE COLOR OF LAW

books.author: by Eddie S. Glaude Jr.
books.description: An appraisal of the life and work of James Baldwin and their meaning in relation to the Black Lives Matter movement and the Trump presidency.
books.name: BEGIN AGAIN

books.author: by Bryan Stevenson
books.description: A law professor and MacArthur grant recipient’s memoir of his decades of work to free innocent people condemned to death.
books.name: JUST MERCY

books.author: by Erik Larson
books.description: An examination of the leadership of the prime minister Winston Churchill.
books.name: THE SPLENDID AND THE VILE

books.author: by Layla F. Saad
books.description: Ways to understand and possibly counteract white privilege.
books.name: ME AND WHITE SUPREMACY

books.author: by Trevor Noah
books.description: A memoir about growing up biracial in apartheid South Africa by the host of “The Daily Show.”
books.name: BORN A CRIME

books.author: by Michelle Obama
books.description: The former first lady describes her journey from the South Side of Chicago to the White House, and how she balanced work, family and her husband’s political ascent.
books.name: BECOMING

books.author: by Isabel Wilkerson
books.description: An account of the Great Migration of 1915-70, in which nearly six million African-Americans abandoned the South.
books.name: THE WARMTH OF OTHER SUNS
